sentence.idiomatic: He smiled. That means he's happy.
Sending different kinds of flowers has different meanings.
The moon represents my heart.
He always talks bad about people behind their backs.
Everybody wants to know the true story behind this event.
A successful man definitely has a woman supporting him in the background.
I've heard that she gets along quite well with other people in the company.
He likes to help other people, so his relationships with others are quite good.
He doesn't really have any relationships with others in the class. Nobody really plays with him.
Don't be so superstitious. It was just a dream, it won't happen.
When buying a house you also pay attention to feng shui? You are just way too superstitious.
In general, older people are more superstitious. They don't like the number four.
Don't kiss me--I don't want to give you my flu.
My whole family has pinkeye--only I wasn't infected.
Is this illness contagious?
He can't drink alcohol. He is allergic to it.
Your neck is red--is it an allergic reaction?
I used a new face cleanser. My skin has had a bit of a reaction to it.
Ah-choo!
Does someone miss you?
What do you mean?
When you sneeze one time it means that someone is thinking of you!
Ah-choo! Ah-choo!
Ah, so many sneezes. This means that someone is talking behind your back.
No way! I get along really well with people. Ah-choo!
Perhaps it means that you will be having a house guest.
You are really superstitious. Ah-choo, ah-choo, ah-choo!
Oh, you're sneezing like crazy! You must have the flu! Stand back a bit, I don't want to catch it.
Don't worry, I'm... ah-choo... allergic to pollen.
